home.highlight: A sacred tapobhumi - the confluence of devotion, peace and divinity.

hero.title: Welcome to the sacred temple in the Western Ghats
hero.subtitle: Lord Parashurama, the sixth avatar of Vishnu, is the presiding deity here. Preserving ancient tradition and renewed in recent decades, the kshetra blesses devotees with spiritual strength, family well-being, and righteous courage.

about.title: About the Temple
about.subtitle: Growing through decades of devotion
paras: Set amidst Western Ghats greenery, this shrine welcomes you into a calm space of devotion, peace and nature.

Sanyasikatte is revered as a Tapobhumi of Parashurama. Key milestones: 1915 - early expansion; 1977 - development committee; 1983 - community hall and facilities; 2006 - stone sanctum, mantapa, courtyard and walls; 2009 - new idol consecration and Brahmakalashotsava.
Today the temple harmonizes faith, tradition and craft.
